description: From French trachyte, from Ancient Greek τρᾱχύς (trākhús, “rough”).

entries.meaning: (geology) A pale igneous rock consisting mostly of potassium feldspar and plagioclase.
examples: The type of rock that results is often described as trachyte and contains abundant crystals of a different kind of alkali-rich feldspar, such as sanidine, rather than plagioclase.
